comment: Had this with Steven at The Wilder. It was pretty good, a little ‘salty’ and not smoky at all. Nothing too crazy or unusual, a decent scotch to have on a Saturday night. @sscheck is always a good tasting partner.
working my way into peated scotch, but overall a nice scotch
A bit bold up front with a decently smooth finish. Very nice neat.
It has a fairly simple taste, but for the price, it’s not bad.

General sweet floral and oak tones dominate initially, opening to express a deeper more complex violet and honey with an under tone of fresh grass and brine, ending in mild burnt peat with a hint of smoke. 

$65 in Kelowna, BC
Honey and mild to moderate sherried fruit sweetness enveloped in a puff of peat smoke. Finishes fast. Decent flavour but a bit simple, just a hint astringent. $75 in Ontario.
Smokey but sweet, not as smooth as I’d want tho
smells sweet in the bottle. sweet and vanilla-y upfront with a long boozey finish
Eher rauchig aber weniger als ein Lagavulin, etwas sanfter (Insel Jura)
This appeals to me. Sweet and smokey. I get a lot from the bourbon barrels.
Passar bäst med lite shh hah shh hah shh hah
Has a nice sweetness but doesn’t blend well with the smokey.
Slightly salty with a tropical tinge. Great for the price.

They've peated it, all right. First thing that hits your nose; very hard to pick up anything else. I don't get any of the sherry finish they mention. A splash of water dampens the alcohol burn and I get the familiar oak taste. Not much else. It's okay but not really enjoyable on its own. Received as a gift but I've given the standard retail price.
